Through these agreements, known as the Artemis Accords, Washington hopes to force upon its view of how space should be governed and push back against China and Russia's own interpretation of space law.

14/ While no one was proud of the way we left Afghanistan, 1 year ago today I was proud of my team & the people who played a part in this mission to do something ‚Äî anything ‚Äî we could to help those who helped us. More on chapter 2, the Albanian odyssey, coming soon.
13/ I would meet them in Albania a few months later, while the amazing team at @SpiritAmerica cared for them in their time of need. https://spiritofamerica.org/blog/a-new-home-for-the-afghan-evacuees

12/ Five hours after the Prime Minister signed off, the Foreign Minister met the plane at the airport in Tirana. Most of the Afghans had barely heard of Albania when the landed there - exhausted to start the second chapter of the story. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FbLWXGYVQAIVfv4.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FbLWXJ_VQAAqF_r.jpg

11/ Amazingly, @USAmbAlbania Yuri Kim and I worked on Iraq together over a decade ago, and I reached out to her. We formally asked Prime Minister @ediramaal & Foreign Minister @xhacka_olta of Albania to accept out Afghans, and give them safe harbor.

10/ Once we got them through the gates of the airport, we had to figure out where to take them ‚Äî and that‚Äôs when my staff and I started googling. We figured out which countries were taking in Afghans, and who their US ambassadors were.

9/ So why did this group end up Albania? Frankly, kismet. When I couldn‚Äôt confirm that I could get them out on a military plane, we bartered with other remarkable groups to get a charter plane to take them out.
8/ Many had or were serving in Afghanistan and put their energy and frustrations with the withdrawal into getting people out.
7/ ‚Ä¶ only happened because a broad network of people around the world ‚Äî some of whom I knew and others  I‚Äôve still never met ‚Äî felt a deep connection to these Afghans & stepped up to help.

6/ Those 10 days ‚Äî from being inundated with thousands of desperate calls, to finding someone to rent buses, to arranging secret meeting spots, to dodging gun shots, making it through Taliban checkpoints, and finding the right military friends to let us in the gates ‚Ä¶
5/ ... and landed in the generous country of Albania, which would become their short-term home.

4/ Today is the anniversary of the first of the three major chapters in their story, and certainly the most terrifying part of the effort: a 10-day odyssey that culminated in getting a caravan through the gates at Kabul Airport, wheels-up out of Afghanistan ...

3/ Another 30+ were former Deputy Ministers, staff & military officers of the former Afghan government who were threatened by the Taliban. All had worked for or with Americans & risked their lives helping us.
